text: Question 16 For a host machine that uses the token bucket algorithm for congestion control, the token bucket has a capacity of 1 megabyte and the maximum output rate is 20 megabytes per second. Tokens arrive at a rate to sustain output at a rate of 10megabytes per second. The token bucket is currently full and the machine needs to send 12megabytes of data. The minimum time required to transmit the data is seconds. 0 - =8 @ - - GATE CSE 2016 SET-1 Computer Network
